Diagnosis
	1. Right breast adenomyoepithelial carcinoma
	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Right breast wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

	Radiotherapy
	Planned

	Chemotherapy
	Planned

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Post-operative, awaiting adjuvant therapy

	Current issues
	Post-operative wound healing well

	Summary of consultation
	I was very pleased to meet [redacted name], a 52-year-old lady who has recently undergone surgery for a right breast cancer. She was accompanied today by her sister who has been providing excellent support. The diagnosis was made through the breast screening program, where a small area of concern was identified in the right breast. Following core biopsy confirmation of malignancy, she underwent right breast wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy on March 15th, 2024.

The final histology shows a 7mm grade 2 adenomyoepithelial carcinoma, completely excised with clear margins (nearest margin >5mm). Sentinel lymph node biopsy was negative (0/2 nodes). The tumor is ER positive (8/8), PR positive (7/8), HER2 positive (3+), with Ki67 of 15%.

She has recovered very well from surgery with minimal post-operative pain. The wound is healing nicely with no signs of infection. She remains very active, walking 30 minutes daily, and has excellent support from her family.

	Further investigations
	Baseline cardiac ECHO and ECG arranged

	Medication prescribed
	None required currently

	Follow up
	Breast clinic in 2 weeks for wound check
Oncology review in 3 weeks with cardiac investigations

	Required GP actions
	None required

	Summary of information given to the patient
	We had a detailed discussion about adjuvant treatment recommendations. Given the tumor biology (HER2 positive status), I have explained the benefit of chemotherapy with anti-HER2 therapy, followed by radiotherapy and hormonal therapy. Written information provided about treatment options. [redacted name] understands the curative intent of treatment and appears to have good understanding of the planned pathway.
